means: 令人满意地，成功地，顺利地

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"大的"之意。
means: big ： 常用词，使用广泛，较口语化。多指体积、重量或容量等方面的"大"，有时也用于描写抽象之物。
large ： 普通用词，含义广，指体积、面积、容量、数量以及程度等方面的大，具体或抽象意义均可用。
great ： 普通用词，可指具体东西的"大"，但更常指事物的重要，人的行为、品格的伟大等，带一定的感情色彩。
grand ： 侧重指盛大、绝大，有气派。

sentence.Network_en: It's not about making the amazing saves. It's the little things and small things that made great gatekeepers great.
sentence.Network_cn: 伟大的门将不是靠神奇的扑救成就，而是靠注重小事和细节成功。（Tim Howard美国国家队门将）

sentence.Network_en: The news will come as a great relief to the French authorities.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个消息会让法国当局大大松一口气。

sentence.Network_en: She's got a great voice and is singing better than ever.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的嗓音非常好，现在的唱功比以往任何时候都要好。

lj.lj_ly: a non-departmental public body made up of the great and the good.
lj.lj_ls: 一个由显要人物组成的非部门性的群众团体。

jx.jx_en_mean: of all sizes, classes, or types
jx.jx_cn_mean: 大大小小的，无论大小的

jx.jx_en_mean: a habitual doer of; an enthusiast for

lj.lj_ly: my father was a great one for buying gadgets.
lj.lj_ls: 我父亲热衷于购买各种小玩意。

lj.lj_ly: we are all to a great extent the product of our culture.
lj.lj_ls: 我们所有人在很大程度上都是自己文化的产物。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English grēat 'big', of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch groot and German gross

entry.def: You use great to describe something that is very large. Great is more formal than big .

example.ex: The room had a great bay window.
example.tran: 这间房有一扇巨大的凸窗。

example.ex: ...a great hall as long and high as a church.
example.tran: 长度和高度与教堂相当的大厅

entry.tran: （数量或程度）大的，巨大的，超乎寻常的
entry.def: Great means large in amount or degree.

example.ex: I'll take great care of it...
Benjamin Britten did not live to a great age.
example.tran: 本杰明·布里顿并未活到很大的年纪。

entry.tran: 重大的；闻名的；令人激动的
entry.def: You use great to describe something that is important, famous, or exciting.

example.ex: ...the great cultural achievements of the past...

entry.tran: 伟大的；著名的； 卓越的；优秀的
entry.def: You can describe someone who is successful and famous for their actions, knowledge, or skill as great .

example.ex: Wes Hall was once one of the West Indies' great cricketers.
example.tran: 韦斯·霍尔曾经是西印度群岛伟大的板球运动员之一。

entry.def: The greats in a particular subject or field of activity are the people who have been most successful or famous in it.

example.tran: 空前杰出的自行车运动员

entry.def: The greats of popular modern music are records that have been successful and that continue to be popular.

entry.tran: 美妙的；好极了的；了不起的
entry.def: If you describe someone or something as great, you approve of them or admire them.

example.ex: Arturo has this great place in Cazadero...
example.tran: 阿图罗在卡扎德罗威望极高。

example.ex: They're a great bunch of guys...
example.tran: 他们是一群很棒的小伙子。

entry.tran: 十分健康的；精力旺盛的；充满热情的
entry.def: If you feel great, you feel very healthy, energetic, and enthusiastic.
You use great in order to emphasize the size or degree of a characteristic or quality.

example.tran: 场面盛大的意大利式婚礼

example.ex: ...her sense of colour and great eye for detail.
example.tran: 她对颜色的感觉和捕捉细节的非凡眼力

entry.def: You say great in order to emphasize that you are pleased or enthusiastic about something.

example.ex: Oh great! That'll be good for Fergus.
example.tran: 哦，太棒了！那将对弗格斯很有利。

entry.tran: 哼，这倒好（表示气愤、恼火等）
entry.def: You say great in order to emphasize that you are angry or annoyed about something.

example.ex: 'Oh great,' I thought. 'Just what I need.'

entry.tran: （用于同类动植物中较大者的名称前）大
entry.def: Great is used as part of the name of a species of plant or animal when there is another species of the same plant or animal which is smaller and has different characteristics.

means.word_mean: 1. relatively large in size or number or extent; larger than others of its kind;
3. (used of persons) standing above others in character or attainment or reputation;

sentences.sentence: "Einstein was one of the outstanding figures of the 20th century"

means.word_mean: 5. remarkable or out of the ordinary in degree or magnitude or effect;

sentences.sentence: "had a great stake in the outcome"
"had a great time at the party"
"many medieval manuscripts are in majuscule script"

means.word_mean: 8. marked by active interest and enthusiasm;
9. in an advanced stage of pregnancy;

auth_sentence.content: She will certainly have a great squad of players.
auth_sentence.res_content: She will certainly have a great squad of players.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She will certainly have a great squad of players.

auth_sentence.content: There is a lot of great stuff coming up.
auth_sentence.res_content: There is a lot of great stuff coming up.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There is a lot of great stuff coming up.

auth_sentence.content: Or was this one of the great lost opportunities?
auth_sentence.res_content: Or was this one of the great lost opportunities?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Or was this one of the great lost opportunities?

means.word_mean: 大的, 巨大的; 非常的, 很多的

sentences.en: That great tree takes away all the light.
sentences.cn: 那棵大树把光线全给遮住了。

means.word_mean: 距离遥远的, 时间久远的

sentences.en: That was a great while ago.
You take great care to do it properly.
sentences.cn: 要格外用心地把这事做好。

sentences.en: He's the greatest man I have ever seen.
sentences.cn: 他是我见过的最伟大的人物。

means.word_mean: 非常愉快的, 令人满意的

sentences.en: It's great to see you again.
sentences.cn: 又见到你, 实在太好了。

sentences.en: He is great on the subject.

means.word_mean: 重要的, 显著的, 值得注意的

sentences.cn: 那的确是一项重大的决定。

means.word_mean: 无比的, 无双的, 极好的

sentences.cn: 她抓住了一个极好的机会。

means.word_mean: 名副其实的, 真正的, 不一般的, 不寻常的

sentences.en: He is a man of great executive ability.
sentences.cn: 他是个具有极高管理能力的人。

jushi.english: It's a great relief to know you're safe.
jushi.chinese: 我知道你平安无事才放下心来。

jushi.english: As the great moment approached, she grew more and more nervous.
jushi.chinese: 她因那重要时刻渐近而越来越紧张。

jushi.english: Many African countries have great mineral wealth.
jushi.chinese: 非洲许多国家蕴藏着大量矿物资源。
